terms.definition:
A terrain card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Roll 1d10. If carrying a Sickle, instead roll 2d10 and add the results.

Setup.
Set up at least 6 spaces away from all other Acanthus Plants.

A terrain card found within the Sunstalker Expansion.

Card Text.
Obstacle, Impassable, Destructible

If you are in darkness, you crack the surface and harvest a handful of salt, carefully storing it. Light penetrates the sculpture from the inside and in one brilliant moment, it is gone. Gain 1 Salt strange resource. Archive the terrain tile.
Setup.
Set up at least 4 spaces from all other terrain.

A terrain card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Survivors in spaces occupied by Tall Grass gain +2 evasion.

If you are standing on a space occupied by Tall Grass, you disappear into it. If you have the priority target token, remove it. You are not a threat until you attack or move out of a space occupied b Tall Grass.

Setup.
Set up at least 4 spaces away from all Tall Grass.

A terrain card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Obstacle, Impassable

Destructible: When a survivor collides with this, stop their movement and archive the terrain. They suffer 1 damage to a random hit location. 
When a monster passes over this, archive the terrain.

Setup.
Set up at least 4 spaces from all other terrain.

A terrain card found within the Lion Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
While the Damsel is standing on the Balcony, the monster suffers -1 speed.
A trapdoor! If the survivor is standing on the Balcony, place them knocked down in a space on the Stage.

Setup.
Set up according to the showdown instructions.

' is a terrain card and 1x1 terrain tile found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. The card has the Atnas crest.

Card text.
Obstacle, Impassable, Destructible

A petrified corpse. Its hollow neck bubbles angrily with an acrid stench.

If a survivor collides with this, they suffer brain damage in addition to the 1 damage suffered for destroying it.

Set up adjacent to a survivor..

Blood Pool is a terrain card and 3x3 terrain tile found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. The card has the Crimson Crocodile crest.

Card text.
Drink from the pool and roll 1d10. If you are standing in the center of the Blood Pool, add +1 to your roll result. Survivors with Hemophobia may not drink.

Set up at least 3 spaces away from all board edges..

A terrain special rule. When a survivor collides with destructible terrain, stop their movement and archive the terrain. The survivor suffers 1 damage to a random hit location. When a monster collides with destructible terrain, archive the terrain.

A terrain card found within the Spidicules Expansion.

Card Text.
When fighting Spidicules, set up x 2 Egg Sacs. 
The Egg Sac explodes! Gain 1 Web Silk strange resource and replace the terrain tile with a Spiderling. Roll 1d10.

Setup.
Set up no more than 3 spaces away from another Egg Sac.

' is a terrain card and 1x1 terrain tile found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. The card has the Arc Survivor crest.

Card text.
You harvest the lantern light. Archive this terrain and roll 1d10.

' is a terrain card and 3x3 terrain tile found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. The card has the King crest and cannot appear outside of Showdown: King.

Card text.
Survivors in spaces occupied by are elevated and gain +2 evasion.

The tree oozes a conductive fluid, submerging the entire showdown board.

While a survivor is not on terrain, they are knee-deep in the fluid. They are always affected by Current, even if they are out of its range or are not wearing metal.

You pass through the door at the base of the tree. Gain +1 insanity and place yourself adjacent to the King in its facing. You cannot do this if all of these spaces are occupied.

A terrain card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Obstacle: Blocks survivor and monster field of view. (Interrupts ranged weapon attacks and monster targeting).

Impassable: Survivors cannot move through spaces occupied by this terrain.

Move onto any space occupied by Giant Stone Face. Ranged weapons gain +2 range and +2 accuracy while atop Giant Stone Face.

Survivors atop the Giant Stone Face move normally on it and ignore obstacles when drawing a line of sight. Monsters may always draw a line of sight to them.

Setup.
Set up at least 5 spaces away from all board edges.

Blood Pool is a terrain card and 2x1 terrain tile found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. The card has no crest and can appear in any showdown.

Card text.
Obstacle, Impassable

You may attempt to pull the waypoint from the ground. Roll 1d10 and add your strength to the result.

Set up at least 5 spaces away from all other terrain..

' is a terrain card and 1x1 terrain tile found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. The card has the Scout crest. The card is not included in the Terrain Deck. It enters play by the Stone Face Cloak.

Card text.
Impassable, Destructible

Swap places with the Hidden Face tile.

When this is destroyed, place yourself in the nearest unoccupied space. You are knocked down and suffer a random severe injury.

A terrain card found within the Lion Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
Honk! Gain the priority target token. Archive the terrain tile. Use this only if you are the Fool.

Setup.
Set up according to the showdown instructions.

A terrain special rule. A survivor cannot voluntarily move into or through any spaces this terrain occupies. Impassable terrain stops all movement, including knockback. If a survivor is knocked back into a space occupied by impassable terrain, they collide with the terrain and their movement ends just before the terrain.

A terrain card found within the Dragon King Expansion.

Card Text.
If a survivor moves through or ends movement on this terrain, they suffer 1 damage and return all of their flammable gear to the settlement storage.
If any other terrain is placed on this, it melts and is archived.
You hop from one stone to another. Roll 1d10.

Setup.
Set up adjacent to the monster.

A terrain card found within the Lion God Expansion.

Card Text.
Obstacle, Impassable

Read hieroglyphics. Use once per showdown. Roll 1d10 and add your understanding to the result. On an 11+,
you may re-roll your next result on a story event during this showdown.
Setup.
Set up adjacent to the monster. (Unless otherwise stated in the showdown setup instructions.)

A terrain special rule. The Lonely Tree terrain has the monster-impassable rule, which has all of the characteristics of impassable terrain, but with the following addition: Monsters may not move through spaces occupied by monster-impassable terrain.

Monsters must move around monster-impassable terrain tiles, if possible. If this is not possible (such as when the monster is instructed to move in a straight line), they instead end their movement in the space before the terrain tile.
Impassable Terrain.

A terrain card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Obstacle: Blocks survivor and monster field of view (Interrupts ranged weapon attacks and monster targeting).

Impassable: Survivors cannot move through spaces occupied by this terrain.

Roll 1d10. Each survivor may use this once per showdown.

Setup.
Set up at least 5 spaces away from all board edges.

A terrain rule. This terrain blocks survivor and monster field of view, interrupting ranged weapon attacks and monster targeting. To check if field of view is blocked, draw an imaginary line from the center of the miniature's base to the center of the intended target's base. If the line comes in contact with a space occupied by an obstacle, the field of view is blocked and the target is not in field of view.

A terrain card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Roll 1d10. If carrying a Pickaxe, instead roll 2d10 and add the results.

Setup.
Set up at least 6 spaces from all other terrain.

A terrain card found within the Dung Beetle Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
(See expansion book for rules.)

Obstacle, Impassable, Indestructible

Indestructible: This terrain cannot be destroyed or removed from the
showdown board for any reason.
 Push: Move the Resin Dung Ball 1d5
spaces directly away from you. If you're not fighting the Dung Beetle Knight, the
ball is empty and you may move it
up to 5 spaces instead.

Setup.
Set up adjacent to the monster.

' is a terrain card and 3x3 terrain tile found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. The card has the King crest and cannot appear outside of Showdown: King.

Card text.
Obstacle, Impassable

You ascend the peculiar structure. Move onto any space occupied by Royal Causeway. You are elevated while atop Royal Causeway.

Elevated: Survivors are elevated while atop specific terrain. They can move normally and ignore obstacles when drawing line of sight. Monsters may always draw a line of sight to them.

is a story event found in the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game rulebook.

Lore.
There was once an entity that knew everything, but never spoke. For every secret that escaped, it became weaker and its enemies stronger.

Aftermath.
Victory.
Any victorious survivors may immediately select Fist & Tooth weapon proficiency, regardless of age milestones. (Any accrued ranks of weapon proficiency are lost when switching to a new weapon type.)
Level 1+
+1 Hunt XP
+1 Weapon Proficiency Level or + Fist & Tooth Proficiency Levels
+Rewards

Rewards.
The Hand hesitates before leaving. Roll 1d10 and consult the table below. The group gains any listed resources or gear.

If the settlement has the Sword Mastery innovation when they defeat a level 3+ Hand, The Hand takes a moment to share some fighting techniques. Roll 1d10 for each survivor. 

On a result of a 3+, the survivor gains Swordsman's Promise secret fighting art.

Defeat.
If the settlement has the Guidepost innovation, The Hand leaves in peace. Otherwise, he slaughters all retired survivors in the settlement.

Ways to Trigger.

A terrain card found within the Spidicules Expansion.

Card Text.
Obstacle, Impassable
Place a Spiderling in the free space nearest to the survivor then roll 1d10. Each survivor may use this once per showdown.

Setup.
Set up at least 6 spaces from all other terrain.

A terrain card found within the Lion God Expansion.

Card Text.
Indestructible

Survivors may not voluntarily pass through the Sinkhole. If a survivor ends their movement on a Sinkhole, they fall into the darkness and are dead! If a terrain tile would occupy any spaces occupied by the Sinkhole, it falls in and is archived.

Plunge into the depths.
Gain 1 survival and Necropolis.
Use once per survivor per showdown, only if fighting the Lion God and if another survivor is adjacent to the Sinkhole.
Setup.
Set up adjacent to the monster.

' is a terrain card and 2x2 terrain tile found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. The card has the Smog Singers crest.

Card text.
If a survivor moves through this, they suffer damage to their body and roll 1d10. On a 6+, they are knocked down coughing.

Scavenge. Roll 1d10.

Set up anywhere..

A terrain card found within the Lion Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
While the Villain is on the Stage, they ignore the effects of being doomed.

Setup.
Set up according to the showdown instructions.

' is a terrain card and a set of 8 terrain tiles found in the Gambler's Chest Expansion. The card has the Bone Eaters crest and can appear only when called for by the showdown rules. 

Card text.
Obstacle, Impassable

The remains of the giant Bone Eaters.

Set up according to showdown rules..

A terrain card found within the Lonely Tree Expansion.

Card Text.
Obstacle, Monster-Impassable, Indestructible.

Set up the showdown with Nightmare Fruit
miniatures placed adjacent to the Lonely Tree.
These fruit are impassable terrain tiles that
occupy 1 space.
The monster starts the showdown with
Nightmare Fruit and Monster Fruit in play.

If the survivors are victorious, and any Nightmare 
Fruit miniatures remain on the showdown board,
they gain the Lonely Fruit strange resource.

Setup.
Set up at least 4 spaces away
from all board edges.

A terrain card found within the Lion Knight Expansion.

Card Text.
If the Ruler is standing on the Throne at the beginning of their act, all survivors gain +1 survival.

Setup.
Set up according to the showdown instructions.

A terrain card found within the Kingdom Death: Monster Core Game.

Card Text.
Obstacle: Blocks survivor and monster field of view, (Interrupts ranged weapon attacks and monster targeting).
Impassable: Survivors cannot move through spaces occupied by this terrain.
If adjacent to the Toppled Pillar on one of its long sides, you may hop over it. Place your survivor in the corresponding space on its opposite side.

Setup.
Set up at least 5 spaces away from the monster.
